description.narrative: IFC's involvement in this Project is expected to: - Support the provision of competitive, clean and reliable base load power to help reduce Cote d'Ivoire's power shortage and boost its economic recovery; - Contribute to the reduction of generation costs for the benefit of Ivoirian consumers; - Stimulate the use of combined cycle technology, making efficient use of the country's natural gas resources as the Project does not use additional gas; - Provide a significant signaling effect, as the second major foreign investment in the country post crisis, to encourage other private investments in Cote d'Ivoire.

The project consists in: (i) the expansion of the existing CIPREL natural gas-fired power plant in Côte dIvoire by adding 111MW steam cycle capacity to 2 x 111MW open cycle gas turbines, converting them into a combined cycle operation, and (ii) the retrofitting of two gas turbines to Dry Low NOx technology for NOx emissions reduction (together the Project). The Project, expected to enhance the efficiency of the power plant by generating 25.5% more power without the use of any additional gas, will be developed, designed, constructed and operated under a 24-year Build-Own-Operate-Transfer (BOOT) arrangement. The Project will sell its power to the Government of Côte dIvoire (GoCI) through Compagnie Ivoirienne dElectricité (CIE), the private transmission and distribution company.
